description:
Whether you're on a consumer product (like Gmail, Search, Maps, Chrome, Android) or a business product (Google Ads, AdSense, Google Marketing Platform, Analytics), you take part in a complete marketing experience as you lead every facet of the product's journey. From determining positioning, naming, competitive analysis, feature prioritization and external communications, you help shape the voice of the product and help it grow a consumer base. This means you work with a cross-functional team across Sales, corporate communications, legal, webmasters, product development, engineering and more. In this role, you'll be involved with product marketing strategy from beginning to end.

As the Head, Mobile Acquisition Consulting, you are a subject matter expert in all areas surrounding both the acquisition, retention and reactivation of users in mobile apps and games.This includes search engine optimization (SEO), search engine marketing (SEM), paid user acquisition, app store search optimization (ASO), and in app virality. Your knowledge extends to both the product and strategy sides, as well as an expert level ability to use data to identify opportunities and deficiencies.

You bring experience in user growth across all lifecycle stages (pre-launch, newly launched, growth stage, etc.). This includes a strong understanding of how developers determine acquisition budgets, and how best to allocate spend across acquisition/reactivation channels.The role works with both apps and games, and you understand the nuanced differences between acquisition strategies for both types.

Additionally, your expertise includes maximizing both paid and organic acquisitions including strategies and product features to increase virality. As the resident expert, you will partner with developers to help increase their sophistication and the performance of new and existing users in their apps and games.This will include reviewing partner performance data to identify opportunities, as well as extended consulting engagements focused on increasing partner sophistication.

Google Play offers music, movies, books, apps and games for your devices, powered by the cloud. It’s a Google approach to entertainment, syncing magically across your devices and on the web. As part of the Android and Mobile team, Googlers working on Google Play do everything from engineering our backend systems, to shaping the product strategy, to forming great content partnerships. They make it possible for people to do things like buy an ebook or song on their Android phone, then have it instantly available on their laptop. The Google Play team helps strengthen the overall Android ecosystem by giving developers and partners a premium store where they can reach millions of users.

qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree in a quantitative field (e.g. engineering, mathematics, economics, etc.) or equivalent practical experience.
  • Experience leading user acquisition, retention and reengagement teams at mobile/game developers

Preferred qualifications:

  • Experience using SQL to retrieve data from large data warehouses, or excellent technical abilities and a strong desire to learn SQL
  • Experience working with data visualization tools to deliver results
  • Expert level knowledge in one or more of the following areas: subscription price optimization, conversion optimization, churn reduction methods, and user engagement & reactivation strategies
  • Excellent analytical and problem solving skills
  • Ability and willingness to be hands on with data and identifying partner opportunities
responsibilities:
• Analyze partner’s app performance versus peers to identify areas for optimization and growth and create presentations which communicate findings, opportunities and solutions to developer’s leadership
  • Support and provide internal and external thought leadership to developers to improve their acquisition, retention and reactivation strategies
  • Assist developers to determine appropriate acquisition budgets and allocation across all lifecycle stages and across multiple games
  • Partner with developers and assist with designing, executing, iterating and quantifying the impact of growth opportunities
title: Head, Mobile Acquisition Consulting, Google Play
